@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, similar magic, or a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual can return the victim to life. The new wendigo remains even if the victim is resurrected.

Tree of Dreadful Dreams.name: Tree of Dreadful Dreams
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:25|name:Force Open a Branch|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard,action:force-open] or @Check[thievery|dc:25|name:Lever Open a Branch|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (trained) to force or lever open a single branch, disabling that branch and freeing any creature trapped within. @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Disrupt the Tree's Magical Animation|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to disrupt the tree's magical animation, shut it down, and free all trapped creatures. Placing a dreamstone in the tree's trunk takes 2 Interact actions and causes the trap to shut down, freeing all trapped creatures. Placing the cursed dreamstone from area B4 in the trunk instead increases the tree's actions per turn to 4 and gives it a +2 item bonus to all saving throws and attack rolls.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.hazarddescription: The statue of the willow tree animates, its branches lashing out to try to grab anyone in area B2.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.routine: (3 actions) The statue uses each action to attempt a branch Strike against a random creature in the room that it hasn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If there are no creatures for it to attack and it has at least one creature grabbed, it instead Constricts. The trap can have up to six creatures grabbed.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if it has no creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and no creatures in the room to attack. If an uncursed dreamstone is placed in its trunk, the statue doesn't reactivate.

Terrifying Visions.name: Terrifying Visions
Terrifying Visions.description: A creature that begins its turn grabbed by the trap experiences vivid, warped visions of true events and must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[4d8[mental]] damage. On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
The tree of dreadful dreams can attempt up to six Attacks of Opportunity each round.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Independent Limbs.name: Independent Limbs
Independent Limbs.description: Any creature struck by the tree's Branch strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. Additionally the tree's Branch strikes do not suffer from multiple attack penalties.

Wailing Crystals.name: Wailing Crystals
Wailing Crystals.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Fracture the Crystals|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,magical] (master) to carefully fracture the crystals or @Check[crafting|dc:27|name:Stop the Resonance|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,magical] (expert) to place objects to stop the resonance, both disabling one 5-foot patch of crystals.
Wailing Crystals.hazarddescription: Three clusters of gleaming, colorful crystals are corrupted with necromantic energy that causes them to reflect negative emotions. All three must be disabled or destroyed to negate the hazard.
Wailing Crystals.routine: (3 actions) The hazard uses each action for an Anguished Shriek. The wailing crystals lose 1 action for each 5-foot patch of crystals that is broken or destroyed.
Wailing Crystals.reset: The wailing crystals deactivate and reset once no living creatures are within 20 feet.
Wailing Crystals.stealthdetails: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:37|name:Notice Ghostly Faces|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,magical] (master) to notice what appear to be screaming ghostly faces in the crystals

HP is 72 for each 5 foot patch.name: HP is 72 for each 5 foot patch

Echoing Cry.name: Echoing Cry
Echoing Cry.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 20 feet of a wailing crystal.

Effect A despairing chorus of cries echoes off the crystals, working its way into the minds of all living creatures in Jewelgate Way Station, affecting them with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} (7th level, @Check[will|dc:33|name:Crushing Despair|traits:mental,emotion,magical,spell] save).

The hazard rolls initiative.

Anguished Shriek.name: Anguished Shriek
Anguished Shriek.description: A shrieking, distorted face composed of writhing necromantic energy lances out of the crystals to target a random living creature within 20 feet. The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental],4d6[sonic]]{4d6 mental damage and 4d6 sonic damage} (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save).

Damurdiel's Vengeance.name: Damurdiel's Vengeance
Damurdiel's Vengeance.disable: Deception 45 (legendary) to pretend to be Erveniss and ask for forgiveness, Diplomacy 45 (legendary) to convince Damurdiel to stand down (elves who are masters in Diplomacy can attempt the check as if they were legendary instead), or Religion 40 (legendary) to call upon Calistria to calm Damurdiel's spirit.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.hazarddescription: An elven woman wearing a robe stands in the water. She beckons anyone who enters the room to join her in the pool.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.routine: (3 actions) The haunt attempts to Strike with the dagger.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.reset: Damurdiel's spirit subsides once she is destroyed or if she manages to reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points. She returns after 1 minute.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.stealthdetails: (legendary) or DC 47 to notice the dagger left in the pool start to move on its own.

Surprise Strike.name: Surprise Strike
Surprise Strike.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 5 feet of the pool's edge

Effect The ghostly elf causes a dagger to rise out of the waters and then fling toward the triggering creature. If the attack is a hit, it is a critical hit instead. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Phantom Bells.name: Phantom Bells
Phantom Bells.disable: @Check[religion|dc:27|name:Recite Against the Power of Hell|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard] (expert) to break the curse with recitations against the power of Hell (2 actions), or @Check[performance|dc:22|name:Perform an Opposing Composition|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard] (expert) to Perform an opposing composition
Phantom Bells.hazarddescription: The echo of diabolic bells reverberates with a bone-shaking clamor.
Phantom Bells.routine: (1 action) The bells toll, dealing @Damage[4d6[sonic]] damage to each living creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic|name:Phantom Bells Toll|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard] save).
Phantom Bells.reset: The bells cease ringing if there are no living creatures within 30 feet.

Distant Ringing.name: Distant Ringing
Distant Ringing.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 30 feet.

Effect Sounds of creaking metal fill the area as the phantom bells begin to swing and the haunt rolls initiative.

Death Throes.name: Death Throes
Death Throes.description:
When one of Ingnovim's assistants dies, it bursts open in a foul-sounding and smelling explosion of toxic viscera and poisonous vapors. All creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:20] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save to resist this blast of poison.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[7d8[poison]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[14d8[poison],2d8[persistent,poison]]{14d8 poison damage and 2d8 persistent poison damage}.

Aluum Enforcer.name: Aluum Enforcer
Aluum Enforcer.publicNotes:
The most common aluum is powered by the bound soul of a loyal city servant, but its creation is among the Pactmasters' most guarded secrets. There are dozens of dormant aluums spread throughout Katapesh, and only someone wearing an aluum charm can activate and command one of these 14-foot-tall soldiers. The Pactmasters entrust few beyond the Zephyr Guard to carry these charms, and stealing such a charm is one of the most severe crimes in the city.

Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bU731I8njNmSAQhQ]{Aluum Charm}, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.

Aluum Antimagic.name: Aluum Antimagic
Aluum Antimagic.description: Aluum enforcers are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A void spell or magical ability grants an aluum enforcer the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A vitality spell or ability makes an aluum enforcer @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.

Paralyzing Force.name: Paralyzing Force
Paralyzing Force.description: A creature damaged by the aluum enforcer's fist Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed for [[/br 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Soul Shriek.name: Soul Shriek
Soul Shriek.description:
The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[9d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure.

The aluum can't use Soul Shriek again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Soul Shriek]]{1d4 rounds}.

Echoes of Betrayal.name: Echoes of Betrayal
Echoes of Betrayal.disable: @Check[religion|dc:35|name:Exorcise|traits:haunt,complex] (master) three times to exorcise the spirits or @Check[diplomacy|dc:39|name:Talk Down|traits:haunt,complex] (expert) three times to talk them down.
Echoes of Betrayal.hazarddescription: Malevolent spirits led by a ghostly image of Ludika rise and begin a deadly brawl. These spirits attempt to overwhelm living creatures, forcing them to join the battle.
Echoes of Betrayal.routine: (1 action) As 1 action, the haunt causes a barrage of ghostly fists to lash from the walls, floors, and ceiling. The haunt attempts a spectral fist Strike against each creature in area H10.
Echoes of Betrayal.reset: After 24 hours, the haunt returns. The spirits are permanently put to rest only if a lawfully appointed judge from Saggorak (or Kovlar) comes into the prison, takes damage from the haunt, and survives the attack.
Echoes of Betrayal.stealthdetails: (master) to hear the quiet murmurs of angry spirits

Confuse.name: Confuse
Confuse.description:
Trigger At least three creatures enter area H10.

Effect The haunt takes control of all creatures in the prison, affecting them with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion} (8th level, @Check[will|dc:37] save).

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description: When a Xotanispawn dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[15d8[fire]] damage to creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save).

Internal Furnace.name: Internal Furnace
Internal Furnace.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the Xotanispawn touches it or hits it with a physical attack

Effect The triggering creature takes @Damage[5d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect] save to negate).

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The Xotanispawn sprays a @Template[cone|distance:60] of magma that deals @Damage[10d10[fire],2d6[persistent,fire]]{10d10 fire damage and 2d6 persistent fire damage} to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save).

The Xotanispawn can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Heat Surge.name: Heat Surge
Heat Surge.description: When the Xotanispawn critically hits, its body surges with heat, increasing the damage of its Internal Furnace to @Damage[10d8[persistent,fire]] damage until the start of its next turn.

Bida.name: Bida
Bida.publicNotes:
Bidas are black-scaled dragons with long, serpentine bodies and bat-like wings. Their legs and claws are smaller than those of most dragons, but their powerful undulating coils, like those of a boa constrictor, are potent weapons capable of squeezing the life from several unfortunate victims at a time.

A bida uses its impressive intellect and powerful magic to pose as a humanoid and infiltrate a settlement. Over the course of weeks or months, it establishes itself as a key member of the village, and only after it has become invaluable to the community does it reveal the terrible price of its assistance: regular offerings of flesh and gold. From this point on, the bida dwells almost exclusively within its smoggy lair, growing fat off the blood of its sacrificial offerings. To hide its presence from the outside world, a bida conceals its enslaved settlement in a large-scale illusion, leaving only a stand of jungle trees where once a thriving village may have been and ordering the townsfolk to destroy any roads in and out of town.

Bidas begrudgingly tolerate others of their kind, instead preferring the company of their small, tasty thralls. In rare cases, a pair of bidas may join forces to conquer a particularly large settlement, extracting that much more wealth from the populace as a result of their partnership.
Bida.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves to disbelieve illusions

+2 Circumstance to All Saves to Disbelie.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves to Disbelieve Illusions

Eight Coils.name: Eight Coils
Eight Coils.description: A bida can Strike with its tail even while Grabbing creatures with it. The bida can have up to eight Medium or smaller creatures grabbed with its tail at a time; it can also grab Large creatures, but they count as four Medium creatures for this purpose.

Mask Settlement.name: Mask Settlement
Mask Settlement.description: By concentrating for 4 hours, the bida hides a small settlement. This is a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spell, except the area is a @Template[burst|distance:500] and creatures are invisible while inside structures in the area. The bida can conceal only one settlement at a time, and must concentrate on the effect for 10 minutes at the beginning of each day to maintain the illusion.

Contingency.name: Contingency
Contingency.description:
Trigger Emaliza is attacked

Effect A 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell is cast on Emaliza; she uses this to escape an attack that she fears would incapacitate or kill her.

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Emaliza hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Emaliza can cast one prepared spell she has already cast today without spending a spell slot.

Warded Casting.name: Warded Casting
Warded Casting.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Emaliza Casts a Spell

Effect Emaliza's magic creates a small defensive aura around her. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points and resistance 20 to either acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage. The defensive aura remains until the beginning of her next turn.

Divine Providence.name: Divine Providence
Divine Providence.description:
Trigger Jahsi rolls a success on a Will save against an enemy's effect.

Effect Jahsi gets a critical success instead.

Glimpse of Redemption.name: Glimpse of Redemption
Glimpse of Redemption.description:
Trigger An enemy damages one of Jahsi's allies within 15 feet of him.

Effect The foe must choose one: The ally is unharmed by the triggering damage, or the ally gains resistance 10 against the triggering damage, and the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

Mental Scream Trap.name: Mental Scream Trap
Mental Scream Trap.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:41|name:Suppress the Magic|traits:magical,trap] to suppress the magic or @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Scratch Out the Ward|traits:magical,trap] to scratch out the ward
Mental Scream Trap.hazarddescription: A psychic scream disorients creatures in the area.

Psychic Screech.name: Psychic Screech
Psychic Screech.description:
Trigger A creature enters the marked area

Effect A psychic wail affects all creatures within 10 feet of the marked area, requiring them to attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round, then stunned 2 when the paralysis ends.

Critical Failure The target is paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
Rinnarv can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within his reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. He can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and he disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
Blood Magic.description: When Rinnarv casts one of his bloodline spells or a spell from his list of granted spells, he creates an aura that protects himself or one of the targets of the spell. The aura grants a +1 status bonus to saving throws for 1 round.

Spell Strike.name: Spell Strike
Spell Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Rinnarv begins to Cast a Spell that targets at least 1 creature

Effect Rinnarv channels his spell through his blade. He makes a Strike with his blade against a target within reach. If the Strike is successful, the target is automatically subject to the spell. If the spell required an attack roll, the target is hit. If the spell required a saving throw, the target takes a -4 status penalty to its saving throw instead. If the spell could target multiple creatures, it targets only the creature Rinnarv hit with his Strike.

Hellcrown.name: Hellcrown
Hellcrown.publicNotes:
The life of a Hellknight is bloody, brutal, and often short. Many who perish in service to a Hellknight order are glad to rest after having served their masters so faithfully, but others seek to continue their work even in death. When a Hellknight is decapitated, the ghostly undead known as a hellcrown is an occasional result. Consumed by the desire to bring about order by inflicting cruelty, hellcrowns haunt battlefields and abandoned castles, slaying all they encounter. A strange fusion of spirit and steel, a hellcrown has no corporeal form by itself, but instead inhabits the helmet it so proudly wore in life. Dangling from the helmet like a shroud is a shadow of the former Hellknight's spine, adding to the creature's terrifyingly gruesome appearance. Hellknights regard hellcrowns with a mixture of disgust and respect, considering the individuals who transform into these floating undead to have been resolute in purpose but weak in body.

A hellcrown usually manifests hours or longer after its body's death, and only when its body is unattended; this might even take days if the Hellknight perished in a major battle. Typically, no recognizable fragment of the Hellknight's former personality survives the grisly transformation into a hellcrown, but in rare and particularly tragic cases a hellcrown might remember its life and hold grudges against those it views as the cause of its death. Regardless of whether they retain memories of their lives or have lost all former sense of self, hellcrowns linger around the site of their death, reminding all they encounter of the merciless principles of their order.

Bleeding Nail.name: Bleeding Nail
Bleeding Nail.description: If the hellcrown hits with a nail Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the nail is embedded in the creature, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and giving it @Damage[1[bleed]] damage (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a critical failure). Each additional embedded nail increases the enfeebled value by 1 (to a maximum of enfeebled 4) and the bleed damage by 1. A creature can remove a nail with an Interact action to reduce the enfeeblement and amount of bleed damage. Pulling out the last nail removes both conditions.

Terrifying Stare.name: Terrifying Stare
Terrifying Stare.description: All creatures that can see the hellcrown and are suffering from its bleeding nail must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] saving throw. A creature that fails is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and on a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. Any creature that attempts a save is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Kalavakus.name: Kalavakus
Kalavakus.publicNotes: Kalavakuses work as slavers in the Abyss, earning them the alternate moniker of "slaver demons"; these fiends round up captured victims and sell them to other fiends or unscrupulous mortals. Pleas for freedom or clemency fall on deaf ears, as slaver demons consider anyone they can catch and hold to be their rightful property and theirs to sell. Kalavakuses know more than just physical means of restraining slaves; they also know how to fetter a victim's soul. The most successful slaver demons have vast slave-pits in the Abyss where they keep stables of imprisoned souls.
Kalavakus.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Horn Snare.name: Horn Snare
Horn Snare.description:
Trigger A creature misses the slaver demon with a melee weapon Strike.

Effect The slaver demon attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the weapon used in the triggering Strike with a -2 penalty. If it rolls a success, it gets a critical success instead. The demon doesn't need a free hand to use this ability.

Liberation Vulnerability.name: Liberation Vulnerability
Liberation Vulnerability.description: The first time each round that a creature escapes from the slaver demon's Enslave Soul or the slaver demon witnesses a creature being freed from captivity or mental enslavement, the demon takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Enslave Soul.name: Enslave Soul
Enslave Soul.description:
The demon enslaves the soul of a living creature within 60 feet. The target can attempt to resist this enslavement with a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

A slaver demon can have only one living soul enslaved with this ability at a time, and no more than one slaver demon can enslave the same soul. If a slaver demon kills a creature whose soul it has enslaved, the demon regains @Damage[20[healing]] HP and the soul is consigned to an eternity of toil in the Abyss, adding to the slaver demon's tally of souls and allowing the demon to enslave another.

Success The target avoids being enslaved and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Failure The target is enslaved and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours or until the slaver demon is slain, whichever comes first.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target also suffers the effects of a failed saving throw against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}.

Flurry.name: Flurry
Flurry.description: Dmiri's multiple attack penalty against her hunted prey is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on her second attack and -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on her third or subsequent attacks.

Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description:
Dmiri designates a single creature as her prey and focuses her attacks against that creature. Dmiri must be able to see or hear the prey, or she must be tracking the prey during exploration.

Dmiri gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} her prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} her prey. Dmiri also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within her second range increment against the prey she is hunting.

Dmiri can have only one creature designated as prey at a time. If she uses Hunt Prey against a creature when she already has a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. Dmiri's designation lasts until her next daily preparations.

Hunter's Aim.name: Hunter's Aim
Hunter's Aim.description: When Dmiri focuses on aiming, her attack becomes particularly accurate. Make a ranged weapon Strike against her hunted prey. On this Strike, Dmiri gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and ignores her prey's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition.

Twin Parry.name: Twin Parry
Twin Parry.description:
Requirements Dmiri is wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand

Dmiri uses her two weapons to parry attacks. Dmiri gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of her next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the parry trait. Dmiri loses this circumstance bonus if she no longer meet this ability's requirement.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.eu2HidLHaGKe4MPn]{Effect: Twin Parry}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.EDpjey6SCdvIYqEc]{Effect: Twin Parry (Parry Trait)}

Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
Twin Takedown.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement Dmiri is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand

Dmiri swiftly attacks her hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against Dmiri 's hunted prey, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same hunted prey, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply Dmiri 's multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by cold and vitality (@Damage[5d10[untyped]], @Damage[2d8[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by void (area @Damage[2d8[healing]] HP); slowed by earth

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Necrotic Field.name: Necrotic Field
Necrotic Field.description:
30 feet. Vitality energy effects within the golem's necrotic field deal only half their normal damage. Additionally, all undead within its aura deal an additional @Damage[1d6[void]] damage with their natural attacks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.kjP0J97hhoIhbF3M]{Effect: Necrotic Field}

Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh
Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Pr1ruNTbzGn3H9w5]{Stone to Flesh} spell negates the golem's antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell reverses this effect immediately.

Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description: The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it takes damage equal to that dealt by the golem's fist Strike

Necrotic Affliction.name: Necrotic Affliction
Necrotic Affliction.description:
Trigger The golem hits a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} creature.

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure) as the golem's lazurite leeches vital energies and causes wounds to rot.

Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
Necrotic Pulse.description: Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or take @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as their flesh and bones temporarily atrophy. The golem can't use Necrotic Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Necrotic Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dragonstorm.name: Dragonstorm
Dragonstorm.disable: The dragonstorm can't be disabled-only endured. It ends only once the attack on Breachill and Citadel Altaerein is over.
Dragonstorm.hazarddescription: A massive storm stirs in the skies above Breachill and Citadel Altaerein. As specific events begin during the three waves of the manifestation's retribution, the dragonstorm wreaks localized havoc.

Localized Dragonstorm.name: Localized Dragonstorm
Localized Dragonstorm.description:
Trigger A new wave begins

Effect Roll [[/r 1d10]] to determine which effect manifests from the following possibilities. The placement of these effects is guided by Dahak's will, and they should manifest in the most detrimental locations possible to the PCs.

1-2 Acid Rain.name: 1-2 Acid Rain
1-2 Acid Rain.description: A torrent of acid drenches creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:20]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[6d10[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail also take @Damage[5[persistent,acid]] damage.

3-4 Freezing Wind.name: 3-4 Freezing Wind
3-4 Freezing Wind.description: A barrage of freezing wind and hail assaults all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:20]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[3d10[cold],3d10[bludgeoning]]{3d10 cold damage and 3d10 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

5-6 Bolts of Lightning.name: 5-6 Bolts of Lightning
5-6 Bolts of Lightning.description: Several bolts of lightning strike all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:20]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[6d10[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

7-8 Flaming Vortex.name: 7-8 Flaming Vortex
7-8 Flaming Vortex.description: Gouts of flame fall on all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:20]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[6d10[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves also take @Damage[5[persistent,fire]] damage.

9-10 Poison Miasma.name: 9-10 Poison Miasma
9-10 Poison Miasma.description: Poisonous mist rolls forth, covering a @Template[burst|distance:20] for 1 round. Creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures outside it become concealed to creatures within it. Creatures within the mist take @Damage[6d10[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description:
Ingnovim carries

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.GttLYMT2welSpwCd]{Acid Flask (Major)}

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.cLZrOihPht5M7eTw]{Alchemist's Fire (Major)}

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nS75vsM3x5jxlUqn]{Bestial Mutagen (Major)}

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rpbbfkexLhtadBDV]{Bottled Lightning (Major)}

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4DJQID8GIlxQ7b9C]{Frost Vial (Major)}

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.1kNp6yOS0aZPBPzZ]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Major)}

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qK964kZz1ALcysOa]{Elixir of Life (True)}

These items last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations.

Inject Unstable Mutagen.name: Inject Unstable Mutagen
Inject Unstable Mutagen.description:
Trigger Ingnovim damages a creature with a syringe Strike

Effect The creature injected with unstable mutagen must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save to resist the injection.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The target's body shifts and mutates, growing difficult to control; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours.

Critical Failure The target's body completely distorts into a shuddering blob of warped flesh that is incapable of action; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. Every 24 hours, the target may attempt a new saving throw against this effect; on a critical success, the paralysis ends.

Mutagenic Adaptation.name: Mutagenic Adaptation
Mutagenic Adaptation.description: Ingnovim's body has adapted to the constant use of his mutagens. He does not suffer the drawback of any bestial mutagens but is still affected normally by other mutagens.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Ingnovim draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Luminous Ward.name: Luminous Ward
Luminous Ward.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable the wards or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the ward
Luminous Ward.hazarddescription: A burst of radiance explodes from the door.

Radiant Explosion.name: Radiant Explosion
Radiant Explosion.description:
Trigger A creature touches the door

Effect All creatures within 20 feet of the door are scorched with brilliant light, taking @Damage[20d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). A creature that fails this save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 hour (or permanently on a critical failure).

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Ishti can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes, but it does prevent them from using her cursed touch. Ishti has a fixed humanoid form-they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Matriarch's Caress.name: Matriarch's Caress
Matriarch's Caress.description:
Ishti touches a creature, who must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} if it critically fails).

If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (or 2 if it critically fails) (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description: Ishti applies a poison to a piercing or slashing weapon of her choice.

Quick Dervish Strike.name: Quick Dervish Strike
Quick Dervish Strike.description: Ishti makes a dagger attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward her multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch's caress.

Batter the Fallen.name: Batter the Fallen
Batter the Fallen.description: The Scarlet Triad Bruiser's kick Strikes deal 2d6 extra damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures.

Brutal Cleave.name: Brutal Cleave
Brutal Cleave.description:
Trigger The bruiser's melee Strike kills a creature or knocks it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, and another foe is adjacent to that creature.

Effect The bruiser makes another melee Strike against the second foe at the same multiple attack penalty as the triggering Strike.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The bruiser has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect The bruiser attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. They must succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+23 #Manacles]]{+23} modifier against the target's AC.

Pummeling Flurry.name: Pummeling Flurry
Pummeling Flurry.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The bruiser makes a greatclub Strike and a kick Strike. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses.

Intimidating Attack of Opportunity.name: Intimidating Attack of Opportunity
Intimidating Attack of Opportunity.description:
Kralgurn's Attacks of Opportunity not only wound creatures, but also shatter their confidence. If Kralgurn hits and deals damage with an Attack of Opportunity, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Fearsome Brute.name: Fearsome Brute
Fearsome Brute.description: When Kralgurn attacks a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature, he gains a circumstance bonus to damage equal to three times the target's frightened value.

Doorwarden.name: Doorwarden
Doorwarden.publicNotes:
Doorwardens are constructs originally invented by elves. Upon first glance, these guardians resemble ornate doors made entirely of steel or even dawnsilver, but when trespassers try to force their way past, the doorwarden transforms into a skilled and sturdy soldier bearing its "door" like a towering shield.

Perceptive travelers can sometimes spot a door warden before its magic becomes obvious. The door often bears a round disk or similar embossment that resembles a shield boss designed for bashing, and the bar that can be lowered to block entry resembles an arm clasping a longsword by the hilt. The original doorwardens crafted by the elves included a motif of elven armor and a metal mask in the style of Alseta's own, though other cultures embellish their own doorwardens with their own themes and sometimes even their own ancestral weapons, such as axes for dwarven doorwardens.

Doorwardens sometimes know about the chambers they guard, and they have been known to speak to trespassers, especially elves. But a doorwarden cannot be persuaded to stand aside; it is bound to the portal where it has been placed and will defend it until destroyed.

Reactive Shield.name: Reactive Shield
Reactive Shield.description:
Trigger An enemy hits the doorwarden with a melee Strike.

Effect The doorwarden can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise its Shield} and gain its shield's benefit to AC against the triggering attack.

Imitate Door.name: Imitate Door
Imitate Door.description: Until the next time it acts, the doorwarden appears to be a door. It has an automatic result of 31 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a door.

Slam Doors.name: Slam Doors
Slam Doors.description: The door opens and slams its doors, making two door Strikes against one creature. If both hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}-stuck between the doors. The doorwarden's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has finished both attacks.

Kobold Explosives.name: Kobold Explosives
Kobold Explosives.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents.

Effect Hezle quickly cobbles together an explosive bomb and lobs it up to 30 feet. All creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5] take @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|traits:interact] save).

Smoky Retreat.name: Smoky Retreat
Smoky Retreat.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents.

Requirements Hezle must be adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect Hezle throws a mix of special powders centered on a corner of her space, creating a plume of smoke filling a @Template[burst|distance:5] until the end of her turn that causes her to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. She then immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaks}, but must end her movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies.

All creatures other than Hezle in the smoke cloud must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Hezle deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Staff Mastery.name: Staff Mastery
Staff Mastery.description: Although Hezle does not cast spells, her obsession with fire and long hours of practice allow her to cast spells from her staff of fire as if she had the spells on her spell list and could cast them. She still must expend charges from the staff normally; when she prepares the staff each morning, she is capable of placing 4 charges in the staff.

Jaggaki.name: Jaggaki
Jaggaki.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Bones of Stone.name: Bones of Stone
Bones of Stone.description:
Requirements The target is standing on or adjacent to a stone surface.

Frequency once per round

Effect Jaggaki calls upon unquiet spirits within the land, causing a giant skeletal arm made of jagged stone to reach out of a stone surface adjacent to a creature within 60 feet. Jaggaki makes a hand Strike against the target via this stone arm rather than using his own hand. If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Jaggaki taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level he can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells.

Jaggaki's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

Paralyzing Touch.name: Paralyzing Touch
Paralyzing Touch.description:
A creature damaged by the Jaggaki's hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save.

The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[medicine|dc:25|name:Diagnose Paralysis] check reveals the victim is alive.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Jaggaki's spellcasting action, Jaggaki attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. If he succeeds, his action isn't disrupted.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The Scarlet Triad agent has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If they succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+24]]{+24 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

Precise Debilitations.name: Precise Debilitations
Precise Debilitations.description:
Trigger The Scarlet Triad agent's Strike hits an off-guard creature and deals damage.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent applies one of the following debilitations to the creature, which lasts until the end of their next turn.

  • Brow Gash The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
  • Deep Cut The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from the Scarlet Triad agent's attacks.
  • Hamstring The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
  • Low Blow The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.otUESSH8BDdPKHtb]{Effect: Hamstring}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The scarlet triad agent deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Weapon Trick.name: Weapon Trick
Weapon Trick.description: When the Scarlet Triad agent critically succeeds at an attack roll against an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, they apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon they are wielding.

Spiritbound Aluum.name: Spiritbound Aluum
Spiritbound Aluum.publicNotes:
Whereas most aluums are animated by the souls of volunteers loyal to Katapesh, the Pactmasters created a handful of more capable (and deadly) aluums powered by the souls of a dozen or more dangerous criminals. These spiritbound aluums are rarely used as peacekeepers, instead serving as assassins, elite bodyguards, or riot control during times of martial law.

A spiritbound aluum has a dull blue crystalline focus that stores constituent souls, surrounded by a host of smaller gems used for trapping souls the Pactmasters wish to deny from entering the Great Beyond. Spiritbound aluums rarely use this soul-binding ability except when instructed by their masters. However, the murderous or embittered souls within the aluum sometimes exert control and willfully consume a departing soul either out of malice or to incorporate it into the construct's core. If not relieved of its trapped souls in a timely manner, a spiritbound aluum can develop enough will to overcome its masters' orders and even awaken to full sentience. These rogue aluums typically lose the mindless trait, are evil, have an Intelligence modifier of -2 or higher, and gain several skills with bonuses ranging from +25 to +32.

Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bU731I8njNmSAQhQ]{Aluum Charm}, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.

Aluum Antimagic.name: Aluum Antimagic
Aluum Antimagic.description: Spiritbound aluums are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A void spell or magical ability grants a spiritbound aluum the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A vitality spell or ability makes a spiritbound aluum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.

Obliteration Beam.name: Obliteration Beam
Obliteration Beam.description:
Requirements The spiritbound aluum has bound a soul using its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} innate spell

Effect The spiritbound aluum transforms the captured soul's essence into raw magical energy, channeling the spirit into a beam that deals @Damage[20d6[force]] damage in a @Template[line|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The remaining fragments of the captured soul are released to the Great Beyond.

The spiritbound aluum can't use Obliteration Beam again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Obliteration Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.

Paralyzing Force.name: Paralyzing Force
Paralyzing Force.description: A creature damaged by the Spiritbound Aluum's fist Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Soul Binder.name: Soul Binder
Soul Binder.description:
When a spiritbound aluum uses its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} innate spell, it binds the soul into its central crystal instead of the normal material component. The crystal can hold up to 60 souls.

When encountered, a spiritbound aluum's crystal typically contains [[/br 1d6 #souls]]{1d6 souls}.

Soul Shriek.name: Soul Shriek
Soul Shriek.description:
The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[16d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure.

The aluum can't use Soul Shriek again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Soul Shriek]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak.name: Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak
Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a red dragon's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Redirect Energy.name: Redirect Energy
Redirect Energy.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet casts an acid, cold, fire, electricity, or poison spell, or such a spell otherwise comes into effect from a source within 100 feet

Effect The manifestation of Dahak makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, or other effects of the spell, as though it were the caster.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The manifestation of Dahak breathes a blast of dragonstorm energy that deals @Damage[5d6[acid],5d6[cold],5d6[electricity],5d6[fire],5d6[poison]]{5d6 acid, 5d6 cold, 5d6 electricity, 5d6 fire, and 5d6 poison damage} in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|name:Dragonstorm Breath|traits:fire,acid,cold,electricity,poison] save).

It can't use Dragonstorm Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Dragonstorm Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Manipulate Energy.name: Manipulate Energy
Manipulate Energy.description: The manifestation attempts to take control of a magical acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison spell within 100 feet. If it succeeds at a counteract check (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+36 #Manipulate Energy]]{+36}), the original caster loses control of the spell, control is transferred to the manifestation, and the manifestation counts as having Sustained the Spell with this action (if applicable). The manifestation can end the spell instead of taking control, if it chooses.

Nketiah.name: Nketiah
Nketiah.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Arborean Arm.name: Arborean Arm
Arborean Arm.description: This magical limb functions in all ways as Nketiah's original arm. The arm can extend a vine to attack in melee, and using the arm, Nketiah has a climb Speed of 20 feet and Climbs as if she had master proficiency in Athletics. Finally, the arm's primal magic allows her to use the spells from her verdant staff as if she had all of those spells on her spell list.

Woodland Elf.name: Woodland Elf
Woodland Elf.description: Nketiah can move at half her Speed on a successful Climb check and at full Speed on a critical success. She can always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} within forest terrain to gain cover, even if she's not next to a wall or obstacle.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: Nketiah ignores difficult terrain caused by plants.

Scarlet Triad Poisoner.name: Scarlet Triad Poisoner
Scarlet Triad Poisoner.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. poison

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Poison.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Poison

Running Poison Strike.name: Running Poison Strike
Running Poison Strike.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The poisoner Strides, poisoning their weapon as they move. The poisoner moves up to their Speed and makes a melee Strike that deals @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage. This has no effect on a Strike that already deals poison damage.

Dalos.name: Dalos
Dalos.publicNotes:
Dalos are reclusive fey that dwell within or near remote volcanoes and volcanic vents and resemble the massive calderas they call home. They more often dwell within the superheated confines of these locales than in the "cold wastelands" beyond their warmth and are therefore rarely encountered outside such environments. Like most fey, dalos are capricious and vengeful. They hate being disturbed above all else and will often warn away intruders with only the throw of a red-hot boulder before attacking outright.

A dalos stands 25 feet tall and weighs in excess of 20,000 pounds.

Magma Splash.name: Magma Splash
Magma Splash.description: Whenever the dalos takes damage from a melee Strike, magma splashes from its open wound and sticks to nearby creatures. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:31|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage as the superheated rock sticks to them and cools. The DC to end this persistent damage decreases by 5 each turn after the first as the magma cools.

Belch Smoke.name: Belch Smoke
Belch Smoke.description: The dalos blasts smoke from its head, creating a @Template[burst|distance:20] of smoke that drifts to a location within 120 feet. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}.

Heat Rock.name: Heat Rock
Heat Rock.description:
The dalos uses an Interact action to pluck a rock from its body or the nearby environment, then uses its internal fires to heat a rock it's holding until the rock is red hot. A heated rock that hits a target on a ranged Strike deals an additional 4d6 fire damage.

Once the dalos heats a rock, that rock retains its heat for 2 rounds before cooling.

Lava Bomb.name: Lava Bomb
Lava Bomb.description:
The dalos causes a volcanic explosion to erupt from its head, lobbing a mass of molten rock up to 100 feet. This lava bomb deals @Damage[6d8[fire],6d8[bludgeoning]]{6d8 fire damage and 6d8 bludgeoning damage} to each creature in a @Template[burst|distance:20]{20-foot radius} of its impact point, with a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save.

The dalos can't use Lava Bomb again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Lava Bomb]]{1d4 rounds}.

Scarlet Triad Thug.name: Scarlet Triad Thug
Scarlet Triad Thug.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. shove, trip, or being knocked prone

+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Shove,.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Shove, Trip, or Being Knocked Prone

Bully's Push.name: Bully's Push
Bully's Push.description:
Trigger A creature within the thug's reach misses the thug with a melee Strike.

Effect The thug attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the triggering creature at a -2 penalty. If the thug rolls a critical failure, it gets a failure instead.

Rock Dwarf.name: Rock Dwarf
Rock Dwarf.description: When forced to move 10 feet or more, the thug is moved only half the distance.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The thug has manacles in hand and is next to a creature.

Effect The thug attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. The thug must succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+18 #Manacles]]{+18} modifier against the target's AC.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The thug deals an extra 1d8 damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the thug's allies.

Double Slice.name: Double Slice
Double Slice.description: The Ekujae guardian makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their daggers. The guardian combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistance, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the guardian's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The ekujae guardian deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: The Ekujae guardian ignores difficult terrain from plants.

Gloomglow Mushrooms.name: Gloomglow Mushrooms
Gloomglow Mushrooms.disable: @Check[survival|dc:22|name:Clear Patch of Mushrooms|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] (expert) to remove a 5-foot-patch without triggering the mushrooms.
Gloomglow Mushrooms.hazarddescription: A field of grass-like fungal filaments amid clusters of softly glowing, long-stalked mushrooms.

Glowing Spores.name: Glowing Spores
Glowing Spores.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the mushrooms' space or damages the mushrooms. The mushrooms can't use this reaction if the damage was cold damage.

Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 10 feet are sprayed with itchy, distracting, glowing spores and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] save. On a failed save, the creatures become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) and take a -4 penalty to Stealth checks until the spores lose potency in 24 hours or are removed. This requires washing them off by bathing in water for a minute, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation} spell, or a similar measure allowed by the GM.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.eZL4B1P4H8hr1CAn]{Effect: Glowing Spores}

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghastly bear is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghastly bear devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[6d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghast Fever.name: Ghast Fever
Ghast Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

Mauler.name: Mauler
Mauler.description: A ghastly bear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living creature hit by a ghastly bear's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
Belmazog spews a gout of acid that deals @Damage[10d6[acid]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

Belmazog can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Drowning Drone.name: Drowning Drone
Drowning Drone.description:
Trigger Belmazog or one of her allies within 60 feet attempts a saving throw against an auditory or sonic effect.

Effect Belmazog releases a croak that drowns out other sound. She rolls a Performance check. She and boggard allies in the area can use the higher result of her Performance check or their saves to resolve the effects against the auditory or sonic effect.

Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual.name: Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual
Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual.description: This rare and highly specialized ritual, taught to Belmazog by the Scarlet Triad, allowed her to use the fossilized remains of Dahak to erect powerful defenses in the region in the form of dragon pillars, but the resources and time required to perform the ritual again are not available to Belmazog during the course of this adventure. As a result, and since there is no way for the PCs to learn or benefit from the ritual, further information beyond the repercussions detailed in the adventure itself are not presented here.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: Belmazog ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Terrifying Croak.name: Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: Belmazog unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: If Belmazog hits a creature with her tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by Belmazog. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of Belmazog's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 25 and dealing at least 8 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to Belmazog, it prevents her from using her tongue Strike until she regrows her tongue, which takes a week.

Tixitog.name: Tixitog
Tixitog.publicNotes:
Tixitogs are a species of bizarre aberrations that make their homes in the dens of giant spiders. Immune to poison and able to traverse sticky webs thanks to the thick slime that covers their bodies, tixitogs steal food cocooned in spider lairs and prey on spiders themselves, but they are careful never to kill so many that their food supply runs out. Their favorite meal, however, is the odd adventurer or spelunker who stumbles into their nest.

These strange creatures have oblong bodies coated in a viscous and transparent slime, three large black eyes, and eight thick, multi-jointed limbs, four of which are inverted and point upward, allowing the monster to easily crawl on either the ceiling or floor of narrow caverns and squeeze through narrow spaces. Their jaws appear small and tubular when closed but peel apart and stretch to terrifying proportions when opened, as their dozens of pointed teeth part to reveal a freakishly long tongue.

A tixitog usually hides from the spiders in the lair it has claimed, not out of fear but to keep the spiders from abandoning the lair and moving elsewhere. When a tixitog emerges from the shadows, most spiders flee from it rather than attack, and the tixitog uses this behavior to direct entire swarms of spiders where it pleases. This is typically bad news for bands of adventurers who find themselves within a tixitog's lair; in the mass hysteria caused by a skittering swarm of spiders headed straight toward them, spelunkers typically fail to notice the more dangerous threat that follows closely behind.

Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: The tixitog can detect the vibrations of creatures touching a web that the tixitog is also touching.

Tongue Pull.name: Tongue Pull
Tongue Pull.description: When a tixitog hits a Small or smaller creature with its tongue Strike, the target is pulled into the tixitog's mouth. The tixitog can then attempt to Swallow it Whole.

Vision of Dahak.name: Vision of Dahak
Vision of Dahak.disable: @Check[religion|dc:26|name:Counteract Dahak With Prayers|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to utter prayers to a non-evil deity to counteract Dahak's presence (prayers to Apsu allow this check to be made if the character is merely trained in Religion), @Check[thievery|dc:30|name:Divert the Hazard's Energy Back|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to divert the hazard's energies back upon themselves, or a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 26).
Vision of Dahak.hazarddescription: Blasts of fire and smoke pour out of the tunnel walls to coalesce into the burning form of Dahak himself; a PC who succeeds at a @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Recognize Depiction of Dahak|traits:hazard,complex,fire,magical,trap,action:recall-knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge notes that the fiery dragon closely resembles classical depictions of the draconic god of destruction.
Vision of Dahak.routine: (2 actions) The vision of Dahak manifests next to the creature that is closest to the center of the way station, then uses its Breath Weapon in a direction that catches the most possible targets in its area.
Vision of Dahak.reset: The vision of Dahak deactivates and resets automatically once no creatures remain within the Huntergate way station.

Manifest.name: Manifest
Manifest.description:
Trigger A creature is within the way station.

Effect The vision of Dahak appears in a 15-foot space adjacent to that creature and rolls initiative.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: The vision of Dahak unleashes a blast of fire from its burning maw, creating a @Template[cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|traits:magical,trap,hazard] save).

Master Smith.name: Master Smith
Master Smith.description: As the most skillful blacksmith in Kovlar, Kelda's abilities far surpass those of typical smiths. She can Craft items as if she were 16th level. Additionally, she knows how to make a vast catalog of items, including numerous uncommon formulas and several rare formulas. The exact formulas she knows can be tailored to fit the needs of each particular group of PCs, but most are for weapons, armor, and other items that could reasonably be made in a forge.

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: Mialari isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to flanking creatures of 10th level or lower, or creatures of 10th level or lower using surprise attack.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Mialari is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker she can see.

Effect Mialari gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Ranged Legerdemain.name: Ranged Legerdemain
Ranged Legerdemain.description: Mialari can use telekinesis to perform manipulate actions that use the Thievery skill at a range of 30 feet, but she takes a -2 circumstance penalty to her check when doing so.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Mialari deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: When a reaction would disrupt Mialari's spell, she can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check, avoiding the disruption on a success.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Mialari.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures Mialari hits with a critical hit are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against her attacks until the end of her next turn.

Lifeleech Crystal Patches.name: Lifeleech Crystal Patches
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.disable: @Check[religion|dc:30|name:Lifeleech Crystal Patch Disable|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) to utter prayers that quell the crystals' necromantic compulsion to drink blood
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.hazarddescription: Sharp, bloodthirsty crystals make walking through this chamber treacherous.
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.stealthdetails: (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} to note the presence of necromantic energies suffusing the crystals.

Slice Legs.name: Slice Legs
Slice Legs.description:
Trigger A creature with blood moves through a patch of lifeleech crystals.

Effect The crystals twist and slash, animating and cutting into the creature as it walks, dealing @Damage[5d8[slashing]] damage. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:28|traits:damaging-effect,environmental,magical] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature's blood causes fresh growth. A new 10-foot-square patch of lifeleech crystals grows in an adjacent space to the current patch of crystals.

Rusty Mae.name: Rusty Mae
Rusty Mae.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
Rusty Mae adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Magic Passage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description: Once per day, Rusty Mae can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Rusty Mae gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Rusty Mae doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 29), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 25, Hardness 14, and 56 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Rusty Mae can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Rust.name: Rust
Rust.description: Rusty Mae's claws cause metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If she succeeds at a claws Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} attempt, she deals [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness, in addition to the damage she deals to the target with her claws. If she hits an unattended metal item, the item takes [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against Rusty Mae's claw attack, the shield is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}, but no other item is affected on that attack.

Anadi Venom.name: Anadi Venom
Anadi Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, off-guard, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Renali changes into her true form, spider form, or human form. The above statistics assume Renali is in her true form. While in their human form, Renali can't use her fangs attack and loses her climb Speed. When in spider form, she can't use weapons.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spin Silk.name: Spin Silk
Spin Silk.description: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. A single anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.

Emperor Bird.name: Emperor Bird
Emperor Bird.publicNotes:
The emperor bird is native to the jungles of the Mwangi Expanse and known for its brilliant plumage and innate magic. While it usually feeds on lizards, big insects, and other small creatures, the emperor bird is highly territorial and not afraid to attack larger prey. Its beak, resembling that of the much smaller peafowl, is exceptionally sharp, but its deadliest weapon is its tail-the long, whiplike blades of bone hidden among its tail feathers are a nasty surprise for any predator trying to sneak up on the bird.

The emperor bird was given its current name 2,000 years ago when Taldor's Sixth Army of Exploration ventured into the Mwangi Expanse. When the legion spotted this 6-foot-long bird with its spectacular multicolored feathers trailing from its tail, wings, and crest, the soldiers thought the bird regal enough to suit their emperor, disregarding the name the Mwangi had given to the bird generations before, bebaki.

Keeping an emperor bird was, for many years, a sign of prestige among the nobility of Taldor. That was long ago, however, and emperor birds eventually fell out of fashion. Inevitably their former owners forgot about their colorful pets, and hundreds of neglected emperor birds were released back into the wild by weary servants. While many such freed birds perished quickly in the unfamiliar woodlands of Avistan, some managed to hold out, and emperor birds can still be encountered in the Verduran Forest.

The emperor bird uses its brilliant, iridescent plumage for mating displays as well as for intimidating rival suitors and potential predators. Not only are the feathers beautiful, but they are actually magical-a fact that has piqued the interest of alchemists and wizards alike, many of whom have spent decades capturing and breeding emperor birds in the hope of unlocking their arcane secrets. Mages stationed in the Mwangi Expanse will pay a pretty penny for intact feathers from these majestic creatures-or better yet, live specimens.

Dazzling Display.name: Dazzling Display
Dazzling Display.description:
The emperor bird flaps its mesmerizing wings. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} that can see the emperor bird must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is dazzled for [[/br 1d4 #Dazzled Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #Confused Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description: The emperor bird makes tail Strikes against two different creatures within reach. The emperor bird's multiple attack penalty does not increase until it has finished both attacks.

Endless Elven Aging.name: Endless Elven Aging
Endless Elven Aging.hp: per square (6 squares must be destroyed to disable the haunt)
Endless Elven Aging.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) or @Check[religion|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) to calm the restless energies and suppress the haunt for 1 hour; a critical success deactivates the haunt permanently.
Endless Elven Aging.hazarddescription: A haunted mural fascinates characters and swiftly drains their vitality.
Endless Elven Aging.routine: (2 actions) The haunt lures creatures into area A2 using Captivate. Any actions it hasn't used to Captivate are used to drain a living creature in the room with Live a Thousand Lives.
Endless Elven Aging.reset: The haunt continues its routine until there are no targets within 30 feet of the room. It then resets over the course of 1 minute and is able to activate again.

Lifelike Scintillation.name: Lifelike Scintillation
Lifelike Scintillation.description:
Trigger A living creature examines the mural or enters the room

Effect The haunt activates and rolls initiative.

Captivate.name: Captivate
Captivate.description:
The faintly moving images compel one creature within 30 feet of the room to move into the room. The creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:38|traits:charm] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target must spend all its actions on its next turn moving into the room, and is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.
